infodynamics.measures.continuous.kernel

Class EntropyCalculatorKernel

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.kernel.EntropyCalculatorKernel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EntropyCalculator, InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous

    public class EntropyCalculatorKernel
extends java.lang.Object
implements EntropyCalculator

    Computes the differential entropy of a given set of observations (implementing EntropyCalculator, using box-kernel estimation. For details on box-kernel estimation, see Kantz and Schreiber (below).

    Usage is as per the paradigm outlined for EntropyCalculator, with:

    • The constructor step being a simple call to EntropyCalculatorKernel().
    • Further properties are available, see setProperty(String, String);
    • An additional initialise(double) option;

    References:

    • H. Kantz and T. Schreiber, "Nonlinear Time Series Analysis". Cambridge, MA: Cambridge University Press, 1997.
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

      • initialise

        public void initialise()
        Description copied from interface: InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Initialise the calculator for (re-)use, with the existing (or default) values of parameters. Clears any PDFs of previously supplied observations.
        Specified by:
        initialise in interface InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous

      • initialise

        public void initialise(double kernelWidth)
        Initialise the calculator for (re-)use, with a specific kernel width, and existing (or default) values of other parameters. Clears an PDFs of previously supplied observations.
        Parameters:
        kernelWidth - if NORMALISE_PROP_NAME property has been set, then this kernel width corresponds to the number of standard deviations from the mean (otherwise it is an absolute value)

      • setObservations

        public void setObservations(double[] observations)
        Description copied from interface: EntropyCalculator
        Sets the samples from which to compute the PDF for the entropy. Should only be called once, the last call contains the observations that are used (they are not accumulated).
        Specified by:
        setObservations in interface EntropyCalculator
        Parameters:
        observations - array of (univariate) samples

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • computeLocalOfPreviousObservations

        public double[] computeLocalOfPreviousObservations()
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: EntropyCalculator
        Compute the local entropy values for each of the previously-supplied samples.

        PDFs are computed using all of the previously supplied observations.

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the array of local entropy values corresponding to each previously supplied observation.

      • setProperty

        public void setProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
               java.lang.String propertyValue)
                 throws java.lang.Exception

        Set properties for the kernel entropy calculator. New property values are not guaranteed to take effect until the next call to an initialise method.

        Valid property names, and what their values should represent, include:

        • KERNEL_WIDTH_PROP_NAME (legacy value is EPSILON_PROP_NAME) -- kernel width to be used in the calculation. If normalise is set, then this is a number of standard deviations; otherwise it is an absolute value. Default is #DEFAULT_KERNEL_WIDTH.
        • NORMALISE_PROP_NAME -- whether to normalise the incoming variable values to mean 0, standard deviation 1, or not (default false). Sets normalise.

        Unknown property values are ignored.

        Specified by:
        setProperty in interface InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Parameters:
        propertyName - name of the property
        propertyValue - value of the property
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for invalid property values

      • getProperty

        public java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String propertyName)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Get current property values for the calculator.

        Valid property names, and what their values should represent, are the same as those for InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous.setProperty(String, String)

        Unknown property values are responded to with a null return value.

        Specified by:
        getProperty in interface InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Parameters:
        propertyName - name of the property
        Returns:
        current value of the property
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for invalid property values

      • getNumObservations

        public int getNumObservations()
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Get the number of samples to be used for the PDFs here which have been supplied by calls to "setObservations", "addObservations" etc.

        Note that the number of samples may not be equal to the length of time-series supplied (e.g. for transfer entropy, where we need to accumulate a number of samples for the past history of the destination).

        Specified by:
        getNumObservations in interface InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Returns:
        the number of samples to be used for the PDFs
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        Specified by:
        getLastAverage in interface InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous
        Returns:
        the last computed measure value
